comment.author: 38000216@N03
comment._content: My grandfather, Joseph Featherstone, migrated from Darlington, England, to Toowoomba, arriving in 1912. It's amazing to me that the local foundry was sophisticated enough to build trains. Joe worked for many years at the Toowoomba Railway Station as a shunter and railway ambulance man.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: A beautiful machine.  Nicely photographed, too.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: I wonder about that big headlight.  Carbide, maybe?
